results.title: The Pill = Pilula = La Pilule = Die Tablette
results.brief_description: When a pill is dropped in a glass of water, it produces froth which overflows the glass, invades the room, the apartment, the street, the city and ends up covering the whole world.

results.title: Paul Klee: child of creation (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Ed Leimbacher, Joe Valentine, Paul Taylor and King Screen Productions
results.brief_description: With a colourful flow of images, this film directly relates the work of the famous 20th century painter, Paul Klee, to the artistic creations of young children. Klee’s own words are complemented by youngsters’ candid comments to reveal an unmistakable kinship between master and young beginner. A delightful portrait of Paul Klee for all levels.

results.title: Getting started
results.creator_credit: Richard Condie, Jerry Krepakevich, Michael Scott and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: In this animated film the hero attempts to practise a piece of music on the piano. A series of distractions delays him and, when he finally sits down to play, pandemonium breaks loose. A short film that will appeal to those of us who tend to procrastinate. (Awards include: Toronto, Zagreb)

results.title: T.E. Lawrence
results.creator_credit: Malcolm Brown, Philip Donnellan and BBC-TV
results.brief_description: Portrait of “Lawrence of Arabia” a profoundly controversial figure with a reputation swinging between hero worship on the one hand and contempt on the other. Tells the story of his life and death (1935) with the richest and most authentic material available in the hope that a real and credible Lawrence will emerge. Original photographs, drawings of Eric Kennington, and mementos from friends are used. Written and narrated by David Lytton, voice of T.E. Lawrence by Cyril Cusack.

results.title: The Tuna coast
results.creator_credit: Fred Clarke and Tasmania. Dept. of Film Production
results.brief_description: Filmed against the splendour of the rugged south-east coast of Tasmania, the deep-sea fishing enthusiast meets his match hunting the mighty tuna. Examines the well-established sport of deep-sea fishing showing two anglers on the hunt for tuna and other big game fish.

results.title: Reading poetry: haiku
results.creator_credit: John Mattias, Arthur G. Evans and Oxford Films (U.S.)
results.brief_description: Teaches language structure, reading and writing of poetry. Presents three haiku with mood scenes of nature and young children playing as background for the reading of poetry. Shows the basic structure of three lines, totalling 17 syllables.

results.title: School's out
results.creator_credit: Mervyn Scales, H Scales and Auster Films
results.brief_description: Surveys the activities of Australia’s 700,00 city children when their schools close for holidays. For some children, holidays mean a make-believe world of cowboys and six-shooters, hopscotch and football in the back streets. Other children make use of various facilities provided by the community, well equipped playground, swimming pools and junior clubs for yachting, life saving and hiking. The work of such organisations at the Police Boy’s Clubs, Sea Cadet Corps and National Fitness Camps is shown, providing for the healthy recreation of children when School’s out.

results.title: Teamwork on the Potomac
results.brief_description: A story about pollution in Potomac River, showing the river at its worst and describing the difficult climb toward restoration. Discusses pollution, sewage-disposal methods, and water management problems. Considers the teamwork necessary to remove the pollution.

results.title: The New ship
results.creator_credit: Tony Eggleton and Department of the Navy
